Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an Amazons board, storing its shape, as well as each of the squares associated with it. Can also be used to store a "partition", which is a section of a a larger board object

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  Board.SmallestHashValue
      Stores the smallest hash value board, its hash value, and the transformation from the current board, to the smallest hash value board

        private boolean isColumnBurnt​(int columnIndex)
        For this board object and a specific column, checks if the whole column is burnt
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - Index of column to check
        Returns:
        true if column is burnt, false otherwise

        Returns:

      • newBoard

        public Board newBoard​(int startX,
                      int startY,
                      int endX,
                      int endY,
                      int componentCounter)
        Given a board object, and a partition to select, returns a new board which is a copy of that partition
        Parameters:
        startX - X co-ordinate on the original board that the partition will start from
        startY - Y co-ordinate on the original board that the partition will start from
        endX - X co-ordinate on the original board that the partition will end at
        endY - Y co-ordinate on the original board that the partition will end at
        componentCounter - Used when considering components, for splitting a board. -1 means we don't consider components
        Returns:
        The new board object, a partition of the original board

      • simplify

        public Board simplify()
        Simplifying the current board object, by recursively removing outer-most burnt rows and columns
        Returns:
        "simplified" board object

      • boardsEqual

        private boolean boardsEqual​(Board board1,
                            Board board2)
        Checks the equality of 2 board objects, by checking that each square has the same state on both boards
        Parameters:
        board1 - First board we want to check equality of
        board2 - Second board we want to check equality of
        Returns:
        true if both boards equal, false otherwise

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • rotate

        public Board rotate()
        Rotates current board object 90 degrees anti-clockwise, using a transposition ------------- ------------- 2 | X | B | W | 2 | W | X | | ------------- ------------- 1 | | | X | 1 | B | | | ------------- ------------- 0 | | | | 0 | X | | | ------------- ------------- A B C Original board Rotated Board
        Returns:
        Rotated board object

      • split

        public java.util.ArrayList<Board> split​(java.util.ArrayList<Square> partitionStartSquares)
        Splits the current board object into partitions, if possible due to burnt rows or columns. Utilises Connected-Components Graph Algorithm. Also stores the partitions starting squares in the list passed into the method.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of board partitions, or our original board

      • connectedComponentsDFS

        private void connectedComponentsDFS​(Square square,
                                    int componentCounter)
        DFS-based algorithm to give all nodes in a given squares component the same value.
        Parameters:
        square - unburnt square, with a current value of -1
        componentCounter - next component value to be used

      • getSurroundingUnBurntSquares

        Gets a list of the squares that surround a given square, and aren't burnt.
        Parameters:
        originalSquare - The given square
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of the surrounding unburnt squares

                          int transformation)

        Parameters:

        transformation - An integer indicating the type of transformation required
        Returns:

      • transformGameValue

                                    GameValue smallestHashGameValue)
        Transforms the smallest hash GameValue, into the current board GameValue object
        Parameters:
        smallestHash - Contains the smallest hash board, hash value, and transformation from current board
        smallestHashGameValue - The GameValue of the smallest hash board
        Returns:
        The GameValue of the current board
